website_summaries.verdict: Good transition piece from steps to a ramp. We suggest changing the original carpeting for improved traction. Suitable for both cats and dogs.
pros: Fits easily in car trunk or near furniture
Very easy to assemble and transport
Height ideal for beds, low furniture and pet houses
cons: Original tread cover can be slippery, needs modification
Ramp angle is shorter and steeper than expected
Not ideal for older dogs with mobility issues

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for our English Bulldog
customer_reviews.text: We have a 12 year old English Bulldog. The step is large enough for her to comfortably make her way to the couch. We previously purchased the 2-step alternative but the surface area wasn't enough for her. I strongly recommend the product. It has an appropriate amount of surface area. Its not too obstrusive to the decor and has helped our dog maneuver with more ease.
customer_reviews.author: Anapol

customer_reviews.title: English bulldog loves this!
customer_reviews.text: Our English bulldog is having more and more trouble getting up to her favorite perch on the couch. All other pet stairs have been too narrow for her wide stance. They would tump over or the stairs were too small for her large paws. This ramp is amazing. Super aturdy. Dog approved!!
customer_reviews.author: stu

customer_reviews.title: ... some health issues with her legs and it was recommended that she avoid stairs
customer_reviews.text: We have a 15lb terrier mix who has some health issues with her legs and it was recommended that she avoid stairs. So we purchased this ramp to help her get up and down off the sofa. I thought this ramp would be perfect but it has several flaws. First, the carpet is slippery preventing her from getting traction going up. After she slid back down a few times, she refused to use it. Second, the angle is very steep so she was scared to go down the ramp. I like the design and it was easy to put together. Unfortunately, due to the flaws its just not a functioning ramp for us so we'll continue looking for a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah McRoberts

customer_reviews.title: Dissappointed_Does NOT have removable carpet as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Bought same ramp at the beginning of the year. I really liked it so I ordered another one for my daughters dog. Very disappointed 😔. Same ramp but it doesn't have carpet as stated in the description. My first one had the removable carpet. This one has some kind of plastic flooring cover and its GLUED to the ramp! If you're going to change your product you should UPDATE the product description!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely ideal for chubby or special needs cats
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 14.5 lb tripod cat to help him get on my bed. It broke my heart every time he jumped off and landed on one little foot. I have an overweight kitty who started using it right away. Then the other 2. It took my tripod about a month to use it. I have hardwood floors and it doesn't move when the cats use it.
customer_reviews.author: Despina Eleftheriou

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced - But Still Bought Two
customer_reviews.text: They work and hold up well with a 15# dog (I have both the lower 10" ramp and the taller 14" ramp with stair at the top). Wanted to eliminate high jumps - and a few inches is doable for my older dog. My dog will not use the "all stairs" designs - might be because her eyes also have started to fail uses these 90% of the time but occasionally jumps over them instead. The lower ramp has a rough carpet, taller one has a plastic weave which makes me more nervous about claws getting caught, but so far okay.
customer_reviews.author: West Coast Dreamer

customer_reviews.title: Not covered in carpet, but some yucky material that can catch kitty's claws
customer_reviews.text: We live with two senior citizen kitties who are starting to have problems jumping up and down from the bed. I've had good luck with PetGear products in the past and this ramp looked like the right size and sturdily enough made to give them the boost they need. But it is covered with some kind of weird plastic material with holes like a sponge (I thought it would be carpet, but it isn't). My cats have problems retracting their claws (happens as they age) and I am very concerned about them catching their nails in the material on this ramp. Maybe I can figure out some way to recover it.
customer_reviews.author: LC

customer_reviews.title: Love this
customer_reviews.text: This ramp is the perfect size for using next to bed. I use it for an indoor dog house. Great alternative to the narrow steps that came with dog house. Also great for bedside helper for my dog . She is older and I don't want her to get hurt using steps or jumping from high bed!
customer_reviews.author: PGP

customer_reviews.title: dogs wouldn't use until I threw a towel over it ...
customer_reviews.text: dogs wouldn't use until I threw a towel over it. something about the material. but they use regularly with the towel.
customer_reviews.author: road

customer_reviews.title: Safe and easy for my babies
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to keep my puppies (Maltese) from trying to jump off the sofa and hurt themselves. It's the perfect size for the sofa. They were able to use this at 8 weeks and if it's not there, they won't attempt getting on the sofa. It stays in place and is easy to assemble. The non-slip cover on the ramp is great! I have posted videos of my pups on a facebook Maltese page and numerous people ask about the ramp. I have shared the link a number of times and if I didn't believe in the product, I wouldn't have shared it.
customer_reviews.author: Tudy

customer_reviews.title: Not just for big dogs!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this step specifically for my senior dachshund. My windows are 12 inches from the floor and he can’t see out the window - he can’t jump anymore and he’s been so sad. This step works perfectly. He can easily step up on it due to the slight incline. It is big enough for him lay on and rest and he can see out the window. It’s good to hear him barking at absolutely nothing again!! They have perches for cats but nothing for dogs! This works perfectly!!
customer_reviews.author: DonnaSR

customer_reviews.title: Happy momma:-)
customer_reviews.text: Baby Bud won't use stairs, I've tried over and over to help him, just doesn't wrk. So I went ahead and purchased this ramp and he's using it with no problems:-)
customer_reviews.author: Fiona

customer_reviews.title: My Dog Loves This Ramp!
customer_reviews.text: I have a senior 14 lb Dachshund/Jack Russel mix and he loves this ramp. He’s super picky about dog stairs and ramps—if they are too plush or slippery, he won’t use them. This ramp is covered in that loopy plastic that was super popular for flip flops in the 90’s, and it provides enough traction for him to confidently use his ramp. It’s not the cutest piece of decor by far, but it’s lightweight, portable, easy to assemble, and my dog was trained to use it within minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Too steep
customer_reviews.text: A waste of my money. The angle is too steep for my dogs to use it. I have Frenchies and bought this because they are getting older and they love to jump on the couch and bed. This is way too steep for them to use. Maybe it would be good for a cat, but it's not good for small dogs with hind end issues.
customer_reviews.author: CornwallGal

customer_reviews.title: Like a giant plastic Brillo pad
customer_reviews.text: We received this product on time and Un-damaged. However, it was a little bit difficult to assemble. You have to use A LOT of muscle to insert each piece so that they correctly pop together. Once it’s together, the angle and the ramp itself is ok. However, the material on top of the ramp part was not as described. The material is listed as “carpet” but really it’s like a Giant plastic Brillo pad. My dog did not like this material and actually was not able to gain grip as described. She kept slipping. She’s an older dog that suffers from arthritis and joint damage. So she just can’t use it. Unfortunately we will be returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Kaley Brydon

customer_reviews.title: This ramp was too slippery and steep for our dogs.
customer_reviews.text: This ramp surface material was too slippery and steep for our dogs. The dogs are afraid to use this ramp because the material on the surface of this ramp is too slippery for them to get the traction they need to use the steep ramp. They also seem intimidated by the hight of the bottom of the ramp. we tried using a couple of cushions to make it easier for them to step on to the bottom of the ramp, but the slipperyness of the material quickly detered them from using it. I even tried to train them using treats to get them used to it, but the material has no traction and they will not use it.
customer_reviews.author: M.S. ABQ

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, well made
customer_reviews.text: Excellent but. Super easy to out together and very sturdy. The rubber grips prevent moving when our Weiner dog runs up and down. It also has a nice covering to prevent dog from slipping. (Not carpet) I use it beside the sofa and it's a perfect fit. If there's a downside to consider: it's not foldable, and an older small dog with arthritis might not be able to make the incline.
customer_reviews.author: smartiepants2u

customer_reviews.title: I am so glad this item is available
customer_reviews.text: I have a senior cat with arthritis. She is basically "floor" bound. She got to the point where she could no longer jump onto the bed, cat stand or the couch. I tired buying the steps but she would not use those. So I tried the ramp and success!!!! I now have one in the bedroom so she can get on the bed and one in the living room so she can get on the couch and from there get on the cat stand and into the bay window. This is a wonderful product that solved the problem I was having. My Susie can now get to her favorite places again. She is so happy.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Turner

customer_reviews.title: Too slippery
customer_reviews.text: This ramp is not recommended by me. I have a 15 year old puggle that I bought this for to help get on and off the couch. The covering that is on the ramp is slippery and she is afraid to try it again because she slide down on her feet. That is not the intention but that’s how it is working. After that she is now afraid to try it again. It has turned out to be a waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Bdhchicago

customer_reviews.title: Great for dogs who aren’t accustomed to steps
customer_reviews.text: Perfect step for my smooth fox terrier. He’s 10/11lbs and not use to using steps. I’ve bought dog steps before but he never used them. This was great because it allowed enough room so he felt comfortable & it took about a week for him to use it on his own. I would lightly step on it to get into the bed to show him how & he would follow eventually. Now he’s always using it on his own. My dog is 11 years old, and jumping two feet to get into the bed has always been easy as breathing for him. But since he’s older he was having trouble this step made it a lot easier for him!!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and better than the ramps
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy and better than the ramps. We bought one of each, a step and a ramp after our 70 pound dog had ACL surgery on her back leg. She liked the step WAY better than the ramp. We cut the legs off the ramp to reduce the slant but she still perfered the step. This step is sturdy and has a big platform that she can get up on. It could be longer to give her more room to transition but the width is good.
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: Better than Steps and Ramps
customer_reviews.text: These are the “Twins”. They’re both 11 and the Pom mix has arthritis. I have tried stairs and ramps and they won’t use them. This is a very subtle piece that feels like furniture to them. They started using it immediately and now they’re back on the sofa where they belong. I also have two dwarfs (corgi mixes) who don’t need it but have been using it. I read other reviews that said there’s are not carpet and it isn’t removable. Mine is both. I have already recommended to a couple other people.
customer_reviews.author: BeagleMomma

customer_reviews.title: 6" step up from floor to beginning of ramp, but good otherwise
customer_reviews.text: It's easy to put together & sturdy but lightweight in terms of moving around. The ONLY ISSUE is when it's sitting on the floor there's about a 6" - 7" height gap between the floor & the beginning of the ramp that my dogs have to step up that high to start walking up the ramp. A little disappointing as I've had to fabricate a micro ramp to bring the slant to floor level. If I'd have paid closer attention to the pics I'd have chosen a different ramp or built one anyway since I had to build the micro ramp piece in the front anyway.
customer_reviews.author: NubarEbor

customer_reviews.title: Great design.
customer_reviews.text: Well, I like it. But my pet won't use it - yet. She's 12 now and once in a while has a tough time jumping on the bench to get onto my bed. As she gets older, though I expect she'll need a little training but will be happy to use it. It's much better than the 3-step ones I typically see, which would be hard for any dog not tiny enough to use those little steps. It goes together in a breeze and the non-slip top makes it safe. Overall - great design.
customer_reviews.author: Kate A

customer_reviews.title: My 14 year old Sheltie loves his ramp!
customer_reviews.text: I previously tried a stair ramp to the sofa for my senior boy, but he refused to use it. He took to this one immediately after I tapped on the ramp, and blocked access to the sofa except via the ramp. He got it after just a few tries, and now routinely uses it instead of trying to jump onto the sofa on his own. The slightly sloped surface and carpeted ramp make it easy for him to jump without slipping. The ramp has a little space underneath, making it easy to move. It is very stable & doesn't shift when he jumps on it (he's 20 lbs.) Thanks for a well-made and useful product!
customer_reviews.author: Salem Sharon

customer_reviews.title: 16 year old cat understood what to do with a ramp
customer_reviews.text: I have a 16 year old cat who has difficulty getting on my bed and the front window(her favorite spot). I bought 2 other stairs for my cat. She said nope! She’d rather take the hardest way to the window sill or bed. This ramp was highly rated so I gave it a try. I placed it beside my bed and saw her walk up the ramp on her own. No instruction needed by me. My cat seems to grip on the material to stabilize herself going up or down. Not having to jump half way up and literally claw herself up the Mattress. This ramp has allowed my cat to sleep with me more thank you !
customer_reviews.author: sarah joohnson

customer_reviews.title: My senior dachshunds love it!
customer_reviews.text: My 12 year old dachshunds were finding the stairs to the couch we got years ago too difficult to climb, so I bought this ramp for them. It just snaps together. After a few cautious sniffs, they figured it out and adapted very quickly, going up and down, no problem, within minutes. My 2 shih tzus and chiweenie like it too, but they still use the stairs. As long as my weenies have something that won't hurt their backs and legs, I'm happy! Thanks for making such a fine, affordable product.
customer_reviews.author: WeasleyIsOurKing!

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for Elderly Dog
customer_reviews.text: My poor baby is 15 years old and had some issues falling/tripping when she tried to get on the couch to sit beside me. I went online to look for steps but then it occurred to me that since we live in a flat, she has never had to manuever steps/stairs in her life. When I saw this ramp, I immediately realized that this could be the solution and it is! I bought two. I only had to show her how to use them ONCE, and now she uses them all the time to get up and down without injury.
customer_reviews.author: 57steps

customer_reviews.title: *Not* Carpet
customer_reviews.text: Every indication, including the photograph of the product, indicated this item would be carpeted. Not so. It came with some weird plastic surface, like a dish scrubber. It smells. The cat gets his claws stuck in it. I will have to go to Home Depot and try and find some carpet to install in its place. Essentially, this is false advertising because there was no indication -- except random comments buried in the user questions -- to indicate it's not carpet. Disappointing, especially given the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Wordlings

customer_reviews.title: could be a bit better if bigger
customer_reviews.text: Well, this stair definitely has helped me get my dog into and out of the car. BUT...I have a Prius...and even for my car it is too low and too small in length. It would be so much more beneficial to me and my dog, if it were slightly BIGGER. My dog is a medium size dog and weighs about 50 lbs. I still have to lift him up, when I use this. But at least I'm not lifting from the ground up. So that helps. ALSO...he can't easily fit his whole body onto the step. So the whole process is a little awkward. But admittedly it DOES help to use it.
customer_reviews.author: art teacher

customer_reviews.title: Simple Assembly & Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This is a good big one step for dogs. I bought it for my 14 year old dog to keep him from jumping up and down so much. It has taken a while to get him to use it. I think the carpet is a lot of the reason why and the only reason I didn't give it 5 stars. The slickness and lack of any depth for the carpet is the reason he was hesitant to use it. A simple fix with a 'real' piece of carpet with some depth, like you would have in your home, would make it much better and safer for a older pet to use.
customer_reviews.author: K. Walters

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: My senior rottweiler was having difficulty getting in and out of the car. I had ordered her a ramp, but it was too narrow and too steep and she refused to use it. I returned the ramp and got this step instead. It is perfect. She didn't hesitate to use it and can now enter and exit the car with ease. It is too big to fit on the floor board of the backseat, but it is lightweight and very sturdy and stows easily in the trunk. I highly recommend this product. It would be suitable for dogs of all sizes.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Sebella

customer_reviews.title: good size and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I got this to help my dog get in the car. I have a small suv and it was getting hard for him to jump in after he got tired out at the park. My other two dogs just jump over it. But he uses it and once he got the hang of it he can just step right up onto the seat. It is wide and sturdy. Also, it is not heavy to move around. If my dog starts having a hard time ever getting onto his favorite seat, the couch, I will order another one for the house.
customer_reviews.author: not mark twain

customer_reviews.title: Dog couldn't get a grip
customer_reviews.text: It was very difficult for her to use as she kept sliding off.. she has a torn CCL and I wanted to help her with getting on/off the bed which requires a big jump for her. I was hoping a ramp instead of stairs would allow her to just walk and not even have to climb stairs. But she never got enough traction on this and kept sliding down causing her to jump..
customer_reviews.author: SandraJ

customer_reviews.title: All I can say is fabulous!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for our small doggie daycare. Easy to sanitize, non slip. Dogs love them. all sizes! Our dogs like them so much we purchased enough to put 2 end to end to make a doggie play ramp. as well as for getting on the furniture. We even used one once in the grooming room to help a small dog that was i biter not have to be picked up to put on our grooming table. Our table will lower but it was still too tall for this elderly biter to get up there. the ramp was perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: Good sturdy step but not for a larger dog
customer_reviews.text: I wanted something to help our weimer step on our bed from the floor but his shoulder is giving him issues so I wanted something to give a boost. Its a good step being plastic seemed sturdy but the material did feel slick but he was to wide to get both feet on and couldn't figure out how to only to use one side so I returned it being its pricey. If it was cheaper I may have kept it and see if he would eventually use it. Good step overall. If I had a smaller dog it would work.
customer_reviews.author: Steve & Theresa

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and easy for my dog to climb.
customer_reviews.text: The pad on the ramp is great. My dog can climb it easily, once I got her to use it. Every time she would try to jump up on the couch I would put her leash on and I would make her climb it then go down it. I would do that 3 to 5 times. After 2 days she just started climbing it on her own. She is 15 and her poor joints just are not working anymore. Even with medication. I was going to use it next to the bed also but it is bulky and a bit heavy for me to lift so I just lift her up on the bed. She is a happy girl again.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Warren

customer_reviews.title: Excellent ramp for couch
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these ramps for my Beagle who is recovering from back surgery (ruptured disc, IVDD). She will never be allowed to jump on/off furniture again. The ramp is sturdy, easy to assemble, and she was able to navigate it very quickly. I clicked on "other buying options" and bought scratch & dent ramps. The price was almost half, and the ramps are just fine. The savings allowed me to purchase 2 instead of just one.
customer_reviews.author: Rachael G. Miller

customer_reviews.title: It passes my cat's test! He uses it every day.
customer_reviews.text: I have this against my bed because that is where my cat was having a hard time jumping up to. The height goes up to the base of the mattress (I have the mattress on a box spring and metal frame). My cat is 17 and didn't figure it out himself at first. The younger cat used it and then he got the idea. He uses it several times a day and does not seem to have a hard time going up or down from the bed now. It's light, took less than 5 minutes to put together, and overall I am very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: sallybrarian

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: My lab is struggling to get in and out of the car (and up on the sofa). I originally bought a long ramp which he and my other dogs just don't want to use. But this small step/ramp has been so easy to train them to use it. It only took about 3 tries to get them up on it. Once they got on it they were good to go, Now they use it with no problem. The long ramp is still sitting in the garage and no they still won't use it. I wish I would have bought this first.
customer_reviews.author: lissette rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Does the job, took awhile for dogs to get used to
customer_reviews.text: My family has 3 beautiful and stubborn puggles who rather get picked up rather than go up stairs so we tried this ramp and they use it like 1 out of every 6 times. They go down it more than they go up. The front of raised so they put their front paws on the front then kind of kick up...we are trying to find something flat to put in the front. It is kind of steep going to the couch so if you have a small dog, you might need something longer. I am giving it 4 stars because i dont think this should be 55 bucks.
customer_reviews.author: Reviews by ILoveAmazon15

customer_reviews.title: Ease of movement for our dog, ease of mind for us.
customer_reviews.text: Our aging chihuahua has hip trouble that make's it incredibly hard for her to get up and down from our bed. Since she also hates to be picked up she would try to jump down anyway. Now with the ramp she can come and go as she pleased. It is great to see her happy and know she won't injure herself. A must for small dogs, or short legged oned. We are so grateful for this product.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fur Parent approved fur babies working it out
customer_reviews.text: Have 2 mini dachshunds that are gracefully growing old and will be 9 in a few days. The female loves the ramp .. just got it today had no problems getting her to use it. Our male who is more of a tweenie (taller and longer) is scared of it and very unsure of the new way to get on the bed but he will come around.
customer_reviews.author: T-Dawg

customer_reviews.title: Needs some improvements.
customer_reviews.text: I have an 80 pound bulldog. They are short and stumpy and have trouble getting up on anything. I like the simple concept of this: one slopes wide step. Unfortunately, it’s tough to use for more than the sofa (like something higher like a bed) since it is only one height and not adjustable. Also, my pup needs to get to the very edge at the high end and it rocks when he stands there so is scared him...so lightweight for people to move around is great but not ideal for heavy dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for helping our dogs in and out of the car
customer_reviews.text: This step is easy to put together and is steady and sturdy. It does not rock . I put it at the rear seat door of my 4 door sedan and edges perfectly to the car and allows both my small (16 lb dog) and our bigger (40 lb dog) to step into the car with no problem. It saves my back trying to lift the bigger dog when his arthritis is bothering him. It also works great for them to get up onto the couch. It easily fits in my trunk if I want to take it with me but it doesn't fold down so it is a bit bulky. I am so happy I purchased this.
customer_reviews.author: R. Stamm

customer_reviews.title: Wish I would have purchased sooner!
customer_reviews.text: I love this ramp! My mini doxie had surgery 2 months ago and this is the perfect thing for him. I wish I would have purchased it sooner! The material on the ramp is held on with Velcro so you can remove it for cleaning. Super easy assembly. My cat thinks I purchased this for him, of course... he is constantly running up and down it. LOL! Great purchase. The dog does take encouragement for consistent use, but we will get there.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Barrett

customer_reviews.title: Perfect boost for my dog
customer_reviews.text: The step was easy to assemble (I'm not great at assembly). It's perfect for my 43lb Shiba Inu. He's 9 years old and had both knees replaced. I recently got a new car and he had trouble getting in and out because it required an awkward jump for him. The step is perfect! It easily fits in my trunk so that I can use to load and unload him from the back seat. It took him a little while to get used to it, but now he will easily walk in and out. The step doesn't slide or give out. Great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Julia Schuble

customer_reviews.title: Measure before purchasing
customer_reviews.text: I have no complaints about this product. I was too lazy to take the necessary measurements, thought it would be what we needed based on pictures. I was totally wrong. Our bed is low, but this ramp still wasnt high enough to give our dogs a boost onto it. The product is sturdy, easy to assemble and just as described. Id recommend, but encourage you to measure the height and the walkway space you'd have around the ramp to avoid tripping because the base is pretty wide.
customer_reviews.author: KayyyOhhh

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: I have an older cat that can barely walk due to arthritis. It is extremely difficult for her to jump up or down from furniture. I bought this ramp so she can safely get up and get down from our couch. The ramp is well built and sturdy and the material on top of the ramp is perfect for her to get a grip on when going up or down the ramp. I am very pleased with this product and it is definitely well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: T. W,

customer_reviews.title: Too short
customer_reviews.text: Way too short . This would be great if you have one of those low-profile beds. our dog chewed the padding. He is afraid of it and won’t climb on it as he would have to take a big leap onto the bed. My other two dogs don’t like it either. They prefer the staircase they have. It would be best if there was A way to adjust it so it could be higher. That being said, it is easy to assemble, it is dirty. And looks just like the picture
customer_reviews.author: jrs

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy ramp, works well.
customer_reviews.text: The first step onto the ramp is a little high, about 5 inches. My Chihuahua was a little hesitant to try it at first but she has taken to it pretty well. She takes it slow and does ok. The texture of the carpeted area is different, not carpet but a plastic type curly weave. It hasn't caused her any problem though. It seems to be easier for her than the steps she had. I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Not good for smaller dogs.
customer_reviews.text: The design has too sharp an incline for smaller pets and the material is something mine, a maltipoo could not walk on. I thought an incline would be better for the animal but it isn't. I understand you must train pets to incorporate new habits and not assume they will immediately like it. I wasted 3 weeks attempting to train him to use this one before caving and tossing it out. I purchased a regular stair and within one week he has gotten used to it and uses it whenever he wants on the bed.
customer_reviews.author: Useless CauseTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and light
customer_reviews.text: I have ordered many ramps for my senior dog with 2 luxating patellas and all had to be sent back for reasons such as being too steep or the surface being slippery. This was the only one that worked for my dog even though I thought it would not be suitable for his needs since he does have to step up on to it. I don't find the carpet to be slippery as some reviewers stated. I have this against my ottoman which is a little lower than my couch and the ottoman against the couch making it easier for him to get on the couch.
customer_reviews.author: sloro

customer_reviews.title: Very useful
customer_reviews.text: It's been 3 weeks for us to use this. We use it for the bed during the nights and also for the window during the day for my dog to watch out the windows, which he loves doing. I love the mat texture, but I haven't tried to detach to clean yet because I don't see the need to do so yet. It's very light so easy to move, but at the same time doesn't feel real sturdy, but as long as you don't push down one side it just works fine.
customer_reviews.author: ssolatido

customer_reviews.title: Large and Stable - Easy to assemble and easy to move around
customer_reviews.text: Large and Stable - Easy to assemble and easy to move around; the carpet piece is very clean, and attaches with Velcro so it can be removed and washed. The material is all plastic and hollow, though the walls seem quite thick. I can see why there is a dog weight limit on this, no weight more than 150lbs - though it's probably best for dogs no more than 60 lbs if you want it to last a really long time.
customer_reviews.author: A. C.

customer_reviews.title: Love this step
customer_reviews.text: Love this step! My dog is a 100lb lab who has arthritis & has trouble getting in my car. This step is wide enough for his large body & it’s the perfect height for my car (2014 Honda Civic).
customer_reviews.author: Debra

customer_reviews.title: It does the job
customer_reviews.text: For the price I think this is a good purchase. I needed something for a 9 year old chihuahua I found on the street that has serious hip and leg issues. Trying to train him to actually go up and down is the main issue. It fits perfect in the corner of my sectional couch and the height is perfect. The padding could be a little more soft though it's works as a grip so I'm good with that.
customer_reviews.author: Little Filly

customer_reviews.title: Great for dog house!
customer_reviews.text: This is very durable and very easy to assemble. Each piece is lettered on the snap together sides so that they match with their adjoining piece's letter. Directions are easy and it's very sturdy! I used this with Merry Pet MPS002 Wood Room with A View Pet House because the packaged steps were more suitable for a hamster. It works great, my doggies love it!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Horne

customer_reviews.title: Perfect solution for aging dog
customer_reviews.text: Our aging 16 lb. poodle was starting to have difficulty in jumping up on the couch. After looking at other pet steps we settled on this which was the perfect solution for him. We didn’t care for those with small, shallow steps which could trip him and make him feel insecure. He adapted to this ramp very quickly after a few treats and encouragement. The depth of the ramp gives him enough room to jump from one surface to another — a perfect solution for our little guy. So glad to find this!
customer_reviews.author: J. Szymanski

customer_reviews.title: Quality product - just what we needed!
customer_reviews.text: This step is easy to assemble and is sturdy once assembled... I have a ~35 lb beagle and bought this for her after she had surgery on her leg... she's able to step all the way onto it then onto the sofa. The cat even likes it and uses it now. The only issue was the cat initially thought it was a cat scratcher since it's carpeted and at an incline so, if you have cats, you may want to be mindful of that!
customer_reviews.author: HeatherMA

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and light weight
customer_reviews.text: Very light weight and sturdy. Our English Bulldogs took right to it. They never liked any previous steps we have tried, but this step works perfectly for them. The step is large enough for them to get both front and back feet on simultaneously so they can pause while stepping up on the couch. I only wish they had one a few inches taller for higher furniture. The 10" height is ok, but 12 or 14 inches would be a good option for taller chairs.
customer_reviews.author: Robert A. McNeal

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product
customer_reviews.text: I adopted a tiny chihuahua and his mixed breed brother (dachshund mix). Dogs with long backs should not jump or climb stairs to avoid back injuries. I ordered this a couple of days after I started fostering my boys and it is fantastic. They both use it to get up and down the couch. It is extremely lightweight but does not move about. My cat loves it too!! The material on the ramp is nonslip, so my larger dog does not slip and can easily use it. I would highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: rk

customer_reviews.title: Great if your dog won't do stairs
customer_reviews.text: Maisie-Doodle does people stairs, I can't get her near dog stairs. I had no trouble training her to the Stramp, and when "Mama" stays up late, Dear Doggie" has no trouble putting herself to bed. My only critique is my puppo would do even better with a step at the end, I think she'll go for it now, to add a little extra height; I think, as she ages, the hop she has to make at the end to get into bed might be a little too much. I do recommend this product for an area just a bit too far off the floor for jumping, a sofa or a low (14") bed, for the dog that won't do stairs.
customer_reviews.author: 50roses

customer_reviews.title: My Bullie Loves This!
customer_reviews.text: My 70 pound english bulldog loves this thing! It makes it so much easier for him to go up and down from our couch. Seriously considering buying a second one for our car. It's very sturdy. Only minor downfall is that there is no grip on the bottom so it slides on a hardwood floor. We just put a little rug underneath and it works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey

customer_reviews.title: Great for portability
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent product. Easy to assemble and break down when needed. The only drawback, and the reason for the three stars is the padding gets caught in my older cat's claws and he's reluctant to use it. The padding does come off, it's attached with Velcro, so I think in the future I'll replace it with a pad or some other non-skid surface that's not as textured. For dogs it wouldn't be so bad as long as their nails are trimmed.
customer_reviews.author: D. Dorchak

customer_reviews.title: It looks great. Chihuahuas love
customer_reviews.text: This is an add on to the house I bought. It looks great. Chihuahuas love it
customer_reviews.author: JLTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: dachshund
customer_reviews.text: product is fine, the dog is the issue. I can not get him to use it. I heard dachshunds have back issues and he jumps on and off the bed. Figured this would save issues later in his life, but he refuses to use it. Even tried putting a treat at top to get him to try. Have led him up and down so he would understand what it was, but no way. If you have suggestions please comment.
customer_reviews.author: gramma of thr33

customer_reviews.title: Great and perfect height for our couch and nice width ...
customer_reviews.text: Great and perfect height for our couch and nice width for my pug, he feels confident and comfortable to use this, it was pretty easy to get him to! Sturdy and well made, the brown color looks nice with our furniture. Only issue I have is at the bottom of the ramp- it is a sudden and rather large, steep stop to it when my little guy is going down it. He easily can stumble or trip, which makes me really nervous. The reason we got the ramp is because he has problems in his lower back with the spine. I put a mat underneath the ramp to give him a little padding at the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney

customer_reviews.title: No problem with carpet slipping
customer_reviews.text: It does what it says. Other reviews complained about the carpet on it slipping--I don't find that to be a problem. As far as sliding on the floor, I imagine that if you have hard wood floors it might slide, but I'm sure that you can find something to counteract that. My problem is that my dog won't use it! The other problem is that if you have very limited space as I do, it does not store easily--bulky. Not attractive in my living room, either but that's just a personal problem, no flaw in the item.
customer_reviews.author: SophieTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome for the price! I purchased for my miniature dachshund puppy (6 pounds) and she has been using it everyday. At first I had to wrap it in a blanket for extra traction. Now she can use it normally with no issues. I made the mistake of ordering used, and Amazon sent me the wrong product in the correct box. The quickly fixed the issue however. Not a fault of the product.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Great, but needs more thought.
customer_reviews.text: This item is def great as an alternative to the steps. My great Pyrenees def finds this helpful especially in her older age. The only complaint is the grip isn't too good, especially on tile floors. It just slides. We put little traction soles under it to prevent an accident.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa N.

customer_reviews.title: Received damaged. Usable due to having small dogs
customer_reviews.text: I received this today with Used-very good with $3 off price and was not expecting this damage. Said original paging may be damaged(not the product). Should be more than $3 off price. I was expecting an item that was returned in good shape. I guess this was damaged goods in warehouse but was not explained that way. Good thing I have small dogs, <25lbs, whom will use this. Everything else is ok.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy D.

customer_reviews.title: SuperTrax is NOT super!!!!
customer_reviews.text: The supertrax mat is not good. For the last 5-6 moths I have bald spots all over. It is coming off in clumps. Seems to be defective. Is there a warranty on this. Please let me know. I also purchased the wide version and it came with a carpet mat which has not shown any signs of wear.
customer_reviews.author: AF

customer_reviews.title: Dog Familiar with Ramps - Does Not Trust "Plastic Carpet Wire" Mat
customer_reviews.text: Had the more slopped versions of these, dog loved them, but needed the taller version. Dog does not trust the plastic wire matting - seems to catch a nail in the stringyness of the mat and the fact the mat does not lay as flat as the old carpet version. They pretty much ruined a good product with this weird mat. Returning.
customer_reviews.author: West Coast Dreamer

customer_reviews.title: My dogs (all 3 of them) are sketchy on this product
customer_reviews.text: First step is about 4 inches high. My little rug rats have a problem figuring out the ramp plus the first step. Down is no problem. If I place them in the ramp they can climb no problem... they just don't like the first step. Soooo.. if the manufacturer is listening, I recommend that the first step be tapped down to the floor [no step]. Otherwise it's a nicely made plastic product with rubberized grip on the ramp.
customer_reviews.author: MurseJeff

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for small/older dogs
customer_reviews.text: This step is perfect for my 10 year old rescue dog who was terrified of a ramp. Prior to joining our house in Dec he had spent his life in a cage at a puppy mill as a breeder. It's been a long road acclimating him to things as simple as steps. I set it in front of the couch and he used it without hesitation. Made my day! Personally, I like how lightweight it is. I can put it anywhere at a moment's notice. Very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Joint relief for my doggies!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for our two dogs which are Shepherd mix so they tend to have joint in hip problems so I can see them kind of struggling trying to get up on the couch so these steps are perfect. I didn't even have to train them they knew exactly what to do because they wouldn't have to strain themselves as much by using the stair ramp. And it's perfect for different sized dogs because there are other dog steps that are higher than this and I have a couple of those as well. Nice to have a variety.
customer_reviews.author: Aiken, CT

customer_reviews.title: Very stable.
customer_reviews.text: My overweight Shippoo...has arthritis and could not jump up to his favorite spot on the couch. He is now a happy boy. A few Beggin Strips to coax him the first day, and after that he was stepping up and down easily with confidence. The best thing about it is stability. He has tried others that wobbled, no way. Not slippery or too steep.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald

customer_reviews.title: Recommended for small dogs, easy to assemble, would recommend
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our terrier after a surgery to help him get up and down from the bed and couch. Arrived on time and was easy to assemble. It is about a foot and a half tall and about two or so feet long. He took to it easily and it serves its purpose. Would recommend for small dogs as I am unsure how much weight it can actually take - medium size dog would probably be pushing it.
customer_reviews.author: CQ

customer_reviews.title: Pet Gear Stramp Stair and Ramp Combination
customer_reviews.text: Our 13 year old pit hasn't slowed down much, but jumping is a bit more difficult for her. We put this at the end of the bed, put her leash on her and gave her the command "Go Stairs" as we led her up the ramp. It only took a couple of times before she got it. Now she uses her ramp whenever she needs to get up or down from her favorite perch.
customer_reviews.author: TexanNanaAtHeart

customer_reviews.title: Not for me, but it could work for you
customer_reviews.text: I had to return this product but giving it four stars because it was nice and I feel like it could work for others. I initially bought it for my small, about 20 pound, dog who is old and needs assistance getting on her couch. While the ramp was sturdy, the advertised size, and had nice padding to it, it was too big of an initial step up and to much of an incline for my smaller, older pup. I feel like this would work best for younger dogs who can still move around easily, or larger dogs (of any age) that have a bigger step.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but lightweight
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to help my elderly dog get in the car. It only took minutes to assemble, and is lightweight enough to move into position with a foot. It’s very sturdy though. She had to learn to use it as she is suspicious of anything different, but it only took a few times for her to accept it. It has certainly saved wear and tear on my back. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Monica Godbey

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves it
customer_reviews.text: I should have bought this a long time ago -- my dog had back surgery many years ago, so she can't jump off things. I've gotten used to picking her up to get on the couch or bed, but this gave her so much more independence to get on and off the couch whenever she wants. It's a small thing, but I think it has really enhanced her life.
customer_reviews.author: Ted

customer_reviews.title: Great for puppies with leg/spine issues
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect thing I needed to get my 3 month old Frenchie up and off my bed. Took less than 5 mins to assemble and about 30 mins to teach him to use it. It’s a bit steep but the grip on it is good and he takes a running/jogging start and up he goes! It’s actually adorable to watch him use it. Also it doesn’t take up a huge amount of space, we placed it at the foot of the bed and he goes up and down by himself during the night to go to his potty pad.
customer_reviews.author: k619

customer_reviews.title: It looks like it would be grippy
customer_reviews.text: The "Grip" material on this ramp is so slippery, my dog just slid right off of it. It looks like it would be grippy, but it is not at all.
customer_reviews.author: Lulu

customer_reviews.title: Old Wiener Ranch gives A+ rating!
customer_reviews.text: We rescue senior dachshunds so this is a staple in our household. We have two and use for bed and sofa access. If you have hardwood or laminate floors, you may need a rubber mat on the floor for the dog to get traction to get up the ramp. The ramp has a plastic loofa type traction pad which is easy to clean but not necessarily aesthetically pleasing and looks a bit cheap. Plastic is very durable and sturdy for our little guys/gals.
customer_reviews.author: FamlyZu208

customer_reviews.title: Doggie Ramp - Pooch slide
customer_reviews.text: Our dog got hurt jumping off the bed so we added the ramp. It was just as described and assembly was super easy and no tools (thanks). I like the ramp materials and the dog uses it with easy. My only adjustment (again this is minor) is I wish the top landing was just a little longer/wider. I say this because the top is not even with the top of mattress. So my dog has to jump down like 6"-8" to the top landing of the ramp then walk down the ramp. Great product and works great for our needs.
customer_reviews.author: Paul T

customer_reviews.title: So good we bought 2!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing device. I have 2 Chihuahuas and they love being on the couch. One is pretty good at jumping, the other struggles. I added one for the couch and added a second one for the love seat. I have picky dogs but within a few treats on the steps they both use the steps. Great design and very study.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Coleman

customer_reviews.title: Amazing. Just, a really good pet ramp for the price. Sturdy for what it is.
customer_reviews.text: We have 2 of these theyre great. They support up to like 150lbs and they hardly show any wear and tear at all. Unfortunately, the old dog we got this for refuses to use it (think of your joints!), but our (3yo) puppy thinks its the coolest thing and cant get enough of it lol. The other one was to replace the stairs on a 2tier doghouse (that was very poorly made) for our chihuahua and she runs up and down it like you wouldnt believe. If we ever need another I plan to buy this one in particular. Its just such a great product and im more than satisfied with it.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Essential for older/bigger/arthritic dogs!
customer_reviews.text: This ramp is now essential in my home and in my garage. I bought the first one to help my 13yo 60 pound arthritic dog get into my car (sedan). I had purchased a two-stair step to help her get onto the couch but it did not allow her to climb safely or confidently, so I bought another ramp. Problem solved! It is sturdy, and also serves as a scratch pad for my cat - bonus! It's a bit costly, but her comfort, safety, and ability to continue participating are worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy S.

customer_reviews.title: Great ramp for our Corgi!
customer_reviews.text: We had bought stairs for our Corgi to use to get on/off the bed, but she ended up jumping from the top step to the floor, so it kind of defeated the purpose of the stairs! She eventually hurt her leg doing this, so we decided to try a ramp & it's made a huge difference. She goes down the entire thing, easing the impact on her little legs.
customer_reviews.author: Laura N.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble ramp that my dog refuses to use
customer_reviews.text: I gave it 4 stars because it does look like a great ramp. It was easy to assemble and it’s sturdy. That being said, my dog refuses to use it. We have tried treats. We have tried gently placing him on it. Nothing. He hates the thing. So we can’t use it. Very frustrating. Nothing like the dogs in the video. :(. But that’s not the ramp’s fault.
customer_reviews.author: David M. Drass

customer_reviews.title: My Basset Hound finds it easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: I have an elderly basset hound and was concerned that it might be difficult for him to use. He figured it out in no time like a champ. My only concern was that the product slides very easily on our laminate floors. It works well with a non-slip pad underneath it. I have noticed that my dog has approached and used the step from both sides and the front with no issues. The step is well-constructed and was easy to put together.
customer_reviews.author: Diane W.

customer_reviews.title: Definitely Recommend
customer_reviews.text: We have two senior and one young Chihuahua, ranging in size from 3 to 16 pounds. Perfect for daily use by all three, and so much better for the senior dogs than a stairs. I would only like it more if it were taller, as our bed is still much higher than the ramp, and one senior Chi cannot jump from the top of the ramp to the mattress. Other than that, it is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: So happy I found this
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to assemble. Many of the steps and stairs listed around are too small and/or too narrow for my dog's liking, so I was excited when I found this product and it's wide shape. It was perfect to give my dog a less impactful way of getting on and off the couch and her favorite chair; I bought two so we didn't have to keep moving one, but if you did need to move it, it's very easy to, not too heavy at all. My dog is about 55lbs and this stays stable with her on it. Very pleased with this product!
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Dutton

customer_reviews.title: A must have for arthritic dogs.
customer_reviews.text: Solid construction, good height and lightweight. My 65 lb. dog with CCL issues can now get in and out of my SUV without causing additional stress to that bad knee/leg of hers. Note: The “carpet” on the top of it isn’t fiber, it’s rubbery/PVC-like material which is better because it’s easier to clean. Two paws up for this product!
customer_reviews.author: K Z

customer_reviews.title: Saved my pup's trip onto my bed.
customer_reviews.text: Augie, my Yorkie, quit using the steps I had for him. I think they were too insecure for the trip up. He jumps down, so he doesn't use them at all on the way down. So, he was slow to try the ramp, but once he did it was all good. He doesn't hesitate to race up that ramp to beat me into that bed at night.
customer_reviews.author: neverland

customer_reviews.title: Good ramp for price
customer_reviews.text: This ramp is pretty good. The only problem is my dog seems to be afraid of the material below it’s feet ? It feels a little rough ? I get it’s there for grip but perhaps the company can change that out ? When he steps on it he appears to want to just jump off or on.
customer_reviews.author: franklin quach

customer_reviews.title: She uses it!
customer_reviews.text: My dog wouldn't use any other stairs because they were too narrow and she was afraid. Now that she has learned how to use this step, she will actually go to the other side of the couch to get down on with the step. She still jumps up on the couch, but her issue was her front leg that she hurts when she jumps down. I highly recommend this product. It's a great design for her even though it takes up space next to my couch, she's worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Michele My Bel

customer_reviews.title: My dog is happy again.
customer_reviews.text: My beagle/lab mix can now get back up to his favorite spot, an ottoman at the front window. He is about 65 lbs and can easily get all four feet on this ramp/step getting up to his seat. It also works great for him to step up into the SUV when its time for a car ride and I can just toss it in the trunk when he needs to get out. Honestly, this has worked out better than expected. I am thrilled.
customer_reviews.author: Valeri Vedral
